messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: arrogance, logic, theories (improved, and more  dangerous)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/12/02 9:26:13 AM, ecsamhill@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/12/02 9:26:13 AM, ecsamhill@... writes:

<< But I truly am *guessing* with little real data. As the mom who's lived
every minute with your kids, *you're the one* that has the insight. >>

But I'm a factor, so I can't see it. And one family with three kids isn't a
scientific sample. We're in that place where we can't have "proof." Even if
a mom had 120 kids and kept great records of conditions, the kids would each
be born to a mom of a different age, and into a different environment, with a
dad who had more money, or less sanity, or whatever all. <g> And the birth
order factors! Yikes!

<< I don't believe
I can take all the credit for the fact that my son is outstandingly
reasonable at the age of 8. For goodness sake, he's far more reasonable
than I am. How could it be my doing? >>

At least school isn't frustrating his reason.

Sandra
